Here's Me!

I am pursuing my Master's in Computer Science at Arizona State University. My areas of focus include Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning and Knowledge Reasoning

Prior to my Master's course, I worked for 3+ years as a Full-stack software engineer at Unisys. I worked on biometric and biographic based identity management solutions based using the Java/J2EE and AngularJS/ZKOSS frameworks.

At ASU, I primarily use Python and Java based frameworks for general programming, data analysis and modeling, and deep learning. My Master's Thesis is focused on building a Question Answering system based on textual entailment and knowledge reasoning to answer challenging questions in the domain of science.

EntailmentDataset

AustralianOpen_Visualization
An interactive visualization of the Australian Open tennis tournament between 2004 - 2014. The visualization is based on the 'Dominance Ratio' statistic of players. The intention is to examine the correlation of dominance ratios and players' performance in the tournament. The visualization was created using the d3.js framework, and the data was prepared using R.

Perform Sentiment Analysis on multiple aspects of drugs such as effectiveness, side effects etc. taken from drug reviews. Source: http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Drug+Review+Dataset+%28Druglib.com%29
